newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada banks soar after U.S. broker hikes ratings.
newsitem.headline: Canada banks soar after U.S. broker hikes ratings.

text.p: Shares in Canada's major banks soared to record heights on Tuesday after an influential U.S. investment firm hiked its ratings on five of the so-called Big Six banks.
The Toronto Stock Exchange's banks and trusts index surged more than 170 points, or 2.5 percent, on news of the ratings upgrades by New York-based Goldman Sachs.

Canadian bank stocks were among the top gainers on Canada's biggest stock market. Royal Bank of Canada led the charge, up 1.75 at 55 in midday turnover of 813,000 shares after earlier hitting a 52-week high of 55.30.
Goldman said it raised Royal Bank and Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce to its recommended list from market outperformer.
CIBC stock was up 1.35 at 66.80 on 765,000 shares after earlier reaching a 52-week peak of 67.50.
Goldman also raised National Bank of Canada, Toronto-Dominion Bank and Bank of Nova Scotia to market outperformer from market performer.
National Bank gained 0.40 to 15.75 on 554,000 shares after reaching a 52-week high of 15.85. TD-Bank rose 0.65 to 39.75 on 1.02 million shares after an earlier high of 40.40.
Bank of Nova Scotia was up 1.20 at 52.80 on 833,000 shares after earlier reaching a 52-week high of 53.70.
Additional details from Goldman Sachs were unavailable.
